subject: Education
title: The Ethics of AI in Education: Who Owns the Algorithm?
description: A 60-second lesson on The Ethics of AI in Education: Who Owns the Algorithm?.

hook.text: AI systems now decide which students get help and which get left behind. No one voted for this.

buildup.text: Algorithms track student behavior, predict dropout risk, and recommend courses. Teachers often don't know how.

discovery.text: In China, AI cameras monitor students' facial expressions to measure engagement. The data goes to parents.

twist.text: The makers of these systems are tech companies, not educators. Their incentive is profit, not learning.

climax.text: AI in education raises the oldest philosophical question in a new form: who should have power over young minds?

punchline.text: The algorithm teaches. But who teaches the algorithm?

quiz.question: What do AI cameras in some Chinese classrooms monitor?
